reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: We stayed here for just one night and wished that we could have stayed for more.
reviews.title: Peaceful stay in the middle of a busy city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Others have called the Dusun an oasis and it's an accurate description. It is calm and quiet with attentive, friendly staff.
reviews.title: Stunning oasis in the middle of the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, this hotel is a rare gem in the middle of the city. From the outside it looks ordinary; it's when you walk inside you get a very pleasant surprise. The atmosphere, food, staff, rooms you could not fault a thing - after a day of sightseeing this place is the place to be as you lay around the pool sipping the odd cocktail or two. The staff are superb and nothing is ever too much trouble and the food is brilliant. A good selection of both Indonesian and Western style foods and the quality is excellent.
reviews.title: Good but you maybe not so if you are a light sleeper.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: If you want a little something more than the usual 'cookie-cutter' style hotel, then this is the place.
reviews.title: A stay in haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I liked this hotel & it is pretty relaxing but I would have liked to have known in advance about the daily 4am early morning wake up call, courtesy of some very local mosques & their very loud speakers. On Sunday morning it felt like someone was in our room with a loudhailer, it was that piercing.
reviews.title: oasis in Yogya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My Wife, Son and I recently stayed for two noghts, this resort definalty deserves the high rating on Trip Advisor. We found the rooms to be great, the restaruant very nice and the whole place to be very relaxing. They organised a tour direct from the airport on our arrival and again for the following day, both drivers spoke good English and were a lot of help during the days activities.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing and Well Run

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We expected some noise from the morning paryers from previous comments but found it to be very quiet and did not distrub us at all.
reviews.title: A green oasis in the urban jungle of Yogjakarta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a deluxe room on the top floor. What a treat! The room was stylish with a seperate bathroom, a lovely balcony with a lounge sofa. We travelled 2 weeks in Sumatra and arriving in this oasis in the midst of the busy hot city was a relief. The staff is fantastic, especially Dhohri and Yuyus from the restaurant and bar we're very helpfull, friendly and always in a cheerfull mood!
reviews.title: Not village inn. More like a classy boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: A 'must do'is to book a massage: delightful. Thre are (fake ..but who cares.. its very relaxing) birdsounds around the pool and plenty of beds with big towels to have a dive, snooze or just read.
reviews.title: Most peaceful hotel in Jogja

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: For all the practical people: there's a supermarket practically next to the hotel whit an ATM inside the supermarket. In the area are a lot of small nice local restaurants and also a Via Via restauarant with a lovely local shop next to it with locally made products.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place feels like it should be by a beach or in the countryside, not in the middle of a city. Its very lush and green, which a beautiful garden and pool and rooms that are full of character and nice touches.
reviews.title: A haven in a busy city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location felt a bit far south from a lot of the main attractions to start with, but its walking distance from a lot of the restaurants and actually ended up making a good base.
reviews.title: Perfect for our needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have balconies that overlook the garden and pool and the canopy beds are extremely comfortable. The restaurant, including the free afternoon snacks and tea, was good and the setting is very nice. We were suspicious that the sweet sound of chirping birds that we heard a lot was piped in, which is a bit strange, but overall its a great choice and very good value for the standard of accommodation.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere indonesian style cozy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After some serious travel around Kalimantan and Java, JVI was a perfect place to rest and explore a remarkable part of Java.
reviews.title: Loved the ambience, decor and friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: JVI has a particular style and décor and we loved it. Clean, comfortable and beautiful gardens meant that on rest days we were able to recharge our batteries. I felt that it was a place that was good for the soul. Its environmental commitment is to be commended.
reviews.title: Yogyakarta's Oasis..... truely a gem !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: First time I stayed in this hotel was some 12 years ago. They just recently opened at that time, and it was love at first sight. From the outside, it didn't show anything. But once you entered the place and passed the lobby, it was beautiful. Mediterranean style, mixed with javanese traditional atmosphere, the impact was amazing. Last june, 12 yrs later, the old love returned. The entrace changed, the old gallery was gone, but inside, it is as beautiful as ever. Still clean, well kept and all the greeneries are grown, adding the calm atmosphere. The location is good, Yogya is a small city, you can reach all must-see spots by becak. The food is to be honest, nothing special. But it doesn't really matter. Close by, you can get many kinds of food. And even they have a supermarket around the corner. It's a great pace for couple, families and friends. Absolutely recommended.
reviews.title: A wonderful little oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is tropical and serene, with beautiful flower petals dropping down into the water. Medium distance away from city centre, train station etc. Rooms are pretty good and have very nice balconies. Free internet is available in lobby area, staff are friendly. Breakfast was a little dissapointing but overall a very good hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing pool area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a group of four that stayed for three nights at this wonderful hotel. The service was fantastic, and rooms clean, cool and full of character. Breakfast was delicious, catering for all tastes, while the pool was so tranquil and beautiful. The staff were so helpful in advising what to see in the city, and we can't wait to return soon. The hotel also had a travel desk, to help arrange those cultural day trips. Just perfect.
reviews.title: A beautiful oasis of peace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was an oasis in the middle of hectic Yogyakarta: a green, lush courtyard with a splendid pool, a poolside cafe, flowers, small streams and set around them the intimate, comfortable rooms. It is a perfect place to relax, read a book and eat, because the restaurant served up fantastic food! A bit of a drawback is its location: it is not possible to walk to the most important attractions of the city, but then again, there is always the becak! Also handy: the super-modern supermarket around the corner, to buy an icecream, water, fruit etc. to enjoy on your balcony. The service was excellent: the staff from the hotel was helpful and they also allowed us, as a special service, to stay a few hours longer in our room, so that we could take a shower before leaving. The restaurant staff was also more than friendly. Highly recommended!!!
reviews.title: Relax!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: An oasis of calm envelopes you when you enter this small inn. The rooms we had upstairs 207 & 208 were lovely. Did not need air con as the fan was enough. The rooms have balconies that overlook the lovely large freeform pool with kids pool. The inn has good food that has been prepared with the highest standards and clean water. We did not eat anywhere else in our 8 day stay. Staff were wonderful especially dory who we wanted to take home, peter, nora and of course putri who organized our amazing tours. They have a spa as well. They have a movie room which was fabulous, we watched a few movies. They really need to get comfortable chairs in the movie room!! Hard couches are not good. If u are a light sleeper then the 4.30 am call to allah goes on for 20 mins so bring industrial strength oil rig rated yellow foam ear plugs. The ones the inn give you are useless. Also the staff start cleaning at 6.30am so it is bit noisy. I was in bed by 9.00 pm!! Great location. The becak driver out front Tekno is trustworthyand can take u to nearby antique shops down fascinating old Dutch lanes. The locals were all very helpful and showed us many painting shops and university art exhibitions we would never have found.
reviews.title: Village inn jewel in crazy city
